title: (x) Wallpaper\* mast head - custom designed {Yves}
content:
what typeface does Wallpaper magazine use for it's mast head?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826165644im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28097.gif)
author: jonathanlawley

comments.content: It is an extensive family used throughout the magazine
Amplitude! You answered my question indirectly thank you

To me the tail of the a in [Amplitude](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826165644/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=10787719274112082&fontname=Amplitude) is different, and the trap in the r is more pronounced. I know from past ID's the inside does use Amplitude, but I suspect this is different.

Ok, Yves, don't listen to me, but I think you were smart, smart,smart - not stoopid, stoopid, stoopid in your first comments. [Meta](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826165644/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-meta/bold-roman/testdrive.html?s=Wallpaper&p=72) has shapes that are so close to this, that your idea of a re-worked Meta is probably a very good bet. As I said, it isn't Amplitude - look also at the tops of the stems, which are different.
